definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Through his shedding blood for our sins.
sentences.chinese: 借著他为我们的罪流血舍命。

sentences.english: People want to kill Ya Ling Xu Ming, a funeral to cover all escape his procrastination.
sentences.chinese: 凌虚上人欲杀明涯，阿丧为掩护众人逃跑舍命拖延。

sentences.english: 13Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.
sentences.chinese: 人为朋友舍命，人的爱心没有比这个大的。

sentences.english: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
sentences.chinese: 人为朋友舍命，人的爱心没有比这个更大的。

sentences.english: Jn. 15:13 No one has greater love than this, that one lay down his life for his friends.
sentences.chinese: 约十五13人为朋友舍命，人的爱没有比这个大的。

sentences.english: Nine younger sister after recovery, see giant to give his life to save her again, cant help falling tears.
sentences.chinese: 九妹痊愈后，见擎天再次舍命救她，忍不住落下泪来。

definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to lose one's life/to get killed
to offer one's life in sacrifice
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
